title: Can I sue title loan company ?
question: I was looking into refinancing my title loan with another company when current loan company found out they offered me a new interest rate and said due to previous problems that I would not have to make a payment until May. Wrote a contract up and when I finally decided to stay with them the voided the contract the day before my payment was due and then called on the 10th stating where was my payment I explain to them the agreement that I had with one of there managers and even sent them the text messages and where he deleted it the day before payment was due and now say I have to pay now or they are taking car
answers: A contract is a contract. How were they able to "void" this contract. Did both parties sign the contract? If so you may have a cause of action against them, but it may cost you more than its worth.

You can sue them, but the cost of the suit may be more than its worth. You can definitely file a complaint with the Better Business Bureau and with the California Attorney General. Go to their website to find the right number.

If you have to resort to a title loan, there is no doubt that your financial situation is in bad shape. Depending on your overall financial situation, Bankruptcy may be right for you. An experienced CA Bankruptcy attorney will be able to determine which type of Bankruptcy, if any is the correct one for you. Use AVVO's Find a Lawyer tool to select a qualified attorney. Good luck. This is merely suggestions for you to think about in discussing your situation with the local attorney.
